snippet: A man under surveillance by antiterrorism investigators was shot and killed on Tuesday by an F.B.I. agent and a Boston police officer after brandishing a long knife.
abstract: Boston police officials say Usaama Rahim, man who had been under surveillance by antiterrorism investigators, was killed by FBI agent and Boston police officer after Rahim threatened them with knife at bus stop in Roslindale neighborhood; Rahim's brother Ibrahim says he was shot in back without provocation; police say there is video of encounter.

byline.original: By JESS BIDGOOD and DAVE PHILIPPS
byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood reported from Boston, and Dave Philipps from New York. Ashley Southall contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: A man under surveillance by antiterrorism investigators was shot and killed on Tuesday by an F.B.I. agent and a Boston police officer after brandishing a long knife.

headline.main: Officers Kill Suspect Who Wielded Knife in Boston
headline.print_headline: Officers Kill Suspect Who Wielded Knife in Boston
